definition: the stream flows without stopping (idiom); unending flow
abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: Sadness was never-ending in Sichuan province after the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 地震後的四川，流淌着川流不息的悲傷。

sentences.english: Visitors entered the exhibition hall in a steady stream.
sentences.chinese: 參觀者川流不息地進入展覽廳。

sentences.english: The great mass of trucks and vehicles, the counter streams of hurrying pedestrians, seemed like a puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 川流不息的車輛，匆匆來去的行人，象一個迷陣似的。

sentences.english: The crowds flowed down the street.
sentences.chinese: 人羣川流不息沿街道走下去。

sentences.english: Traffic circulates in the streets of a city.
sentences.chinese: 車輛和行人在市內街上川流不息。

sentences.english: Trucks and cars flowed along the highway all day.
sentences.chinese: 卡車和轎車整天在公路上川流不息。

sentences.english: There's traffic in the streets from dawn till dusk.
sentences.chinese: 從黎明到黃昏街上車輛川流不息。

definition: endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
lit. rubbing shoulders and following in each other's footsteps/a thronging crowd
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
stream of people/abortion/abbr. for 人工流產|人工流产[ren2 gong1 liu2 chan3]
to travel back and forth/to shuttle
